title: One person dead, others injured after shooting in Raleigh neighborhood
content:
You need to have the Adobe Flash Player to view this content. Please click here to continue.
UPDATE 1/18/2016 - Three of the people shot, including a 17-year-old who was a killed, has stopped to help a stranded driver.
MEMPHIS, Tenn. -- Memphis Police were called to a Raleigh neighborhood after multiple shootings were reported all within blocks of one another.
Investigators told WREG they do believe all of the shootings were related.
They released the following preliminary information to WREG Thursday night.
Just after 7: 30 p.m., Police were called to the 3800 block of Kerwood where a juvenile had been shot.
That boy was rushed to Le Bonheur Children's Hospital in non-critical condition.
Another woman was also hurt at that scene, but it's unclear if her injury was due to a bullet or broken class.
She was also listed as being in non-serious condition.
Police told WREG they believe the other victims left that location after the shooting.
Another female with injuries was located on Winker Drive.
Initial reports indicated she had been shot as well, but after further investigation, it was determined her injuries were caused by shattered glass.
She was taken to the hospital, and is expected to be okay.
The final shooting victim was found on Trudy and was dead by the time officers arrived.
At this time, investigators are searching for two black males wearing Halloween masks.
One is reportedly armed with a shotgun.
If you can help investigators in any way, you are urged to call CrimeStoppers at (901) 528- CASH.
This is a developing story.
